## HttpErrorSerializer.serializerError property

Serializes an HttpError into a detailed object containing both top-level error information and the complete cause chain. This method is designed for logging and debugging purposes.

**Signature:**

```typescript
serializerError: (error: HttpError) => {
        topLevel: {
            name: string;
            message: string;
            code: unknown;
            logLevel: import("../errors/types.js").LogLevel;
            responseMessage: string;
            meta: {} | undefined;
            stack: string | undefined;
        };
        causeChain: Record<string, any>[];
    };
```

## Example


```typescript
try {
  // Some operation that throws HttpError
} catch (error) {
  if (error instanceof HttpError) {
    const serialized = serializer.serializerError(error);
    logger.error('Operation failed', {
      topLevelError: serialized.topLevel,
      rootCause: serialized.causeChain[serialized.causeChain.length - 1]
    });
  }
}
```
